Darren,
do you have any documentation on shaperecog?
I am extremely new to neat and am just trying to
understand it now.
Thank you and sorry to keep bothering you guys.

Rog



--- Darren Izzard <zysyshelp@...> wrote:
> 
> >>Has anyone use NEAT for facial recognition or to
> >>identify objects?
> >Darren Izzard (who is zysyshelp in this group) did
> work
> >that is relevant to this.  He had an "eye" move
> over a
> >shape to identify the shape.  I thought he had
> uploaded his
> >experiments.cpp file to the files section, but it
> doesn't seem to be
> >there now.
> 
> It is still there, in the Files section
> (shaperecog.zip, at the bottom of
> the list), and it gave me very good results. I did
> explain in some detail
> how the experiment worked in an earlier post: I'll
> fish it out if anyone
> wants to see it.
> 
> I have done some more fiddling with NEAT since then,
> incidentally. I had a
> few goes at seeing if I could get NEAT to evolve a
> net which could look at a
> sequence of numbers and then generate a program in a
> simple programming
> language to generate that sequence. Results have not
> been very promising,
> mainly because I've found it difficult to give the
> network a smooth learning
> curve. Making improvements early on seems to require
> quite a leap of
> complexity, and I'm not sure how to solve it. I'll
> go into more detail
> separately if anyone's curious.
> 
> --Darren
> 
>
